name: places/ChIJifxrNplZwokRX8P9kWwIM74
adrFormatAddress: 91 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Quirky shop for secondhand clothes, furniture & home items with proceeds going to diabetes research.

originalText.text:
Absolutely a treasure trove of a gem in the East Village, a must on any thrift store list !!
Recently, I moved into the neighborhood and stumbled upon this shop while on a walk; the windows spoke to me, so I proceeded in and was delighted to find the most incredible array of curated objects I've seen in ages: from mid-century furniture to vintage graphic tees, this place has it all. I am thrilled to have discovered this gem as I am currently outfitting my new apartment, and their furniture selection is next level--as is their customer service team. I was approached by this doll of a human, May, and she walked me through the store, showing me everything they currently had; we landed on a dresser that I do hope fit the space I have, and if it does, I'll be back to purchase. The best part of my time in the store and chatting with May and learning of the incredible work this business does for charity--bravo!

originalText.text: Cure Thrift Shop is a vintage shop that is so well curated and merchandised that the high prices are somewhat forgivable. normally peruse through vintage Ts here bc they are unique and in decent condition. over the years, i have picked up several items here and have yet to be disappointed. the store is well-maintained, clean, brightly lit, and has a bit of character in the way merchandise is organized. all that said, the prices do bend to the higher ends of things BUT there are periodic sales so be patient. tchotchkes tend to be decently priced bc they are eclectic for those looking for interesting decor items.  some of the staff are cool. others are meh. that’s the story of all retail. avoid the store on weekends as it can be a circus but the store is open relatively late for a thrift store which is a good time to swing through…a win for the nocturnal like me.

originalText.text: Beautiful selection that they have curated here! Antiques and clothes to thrift. Home goods and roller blades and charms. I will say the items were very nice but did seem to be priced pretty high and I personally wasn’t really willing to pay for anything that I wasn’t amazed with here. That being said, there were definitely unique and amazing pieces still.

originalText.text: beautifully curated store with very nice items. good sale going on now with 50% off clothing and accessories, meaning i managed to buy this amazing, thick varsity jacket for 60 dollars. without the sale most of the items would have been too pricey though. also got nice leather/cashmere gloves and a hat here

originalText.text: Beautiful shop with a variety of selections of life style goodies, furnitures and vintage clothes. They were all well curated and very clean also in good condition. It’s a fun place to find hidden gem if you are interested in vintage stuff.
